author: Staff report
title: Ottawa shuts out Scorpions
text:
Staff report Published 9:42 pm, Sunday, October 18, 2015 
The Scorpions lost to NASL leader Ottawa 1-0 on Sunday at TD Place in Ottawa, Ontario. 
The win puts Ottawa (52 combined points) on the brink of clinching the NASLâ€™s Fall Season, while the Scorpions (29 points) will now need to win their final three games and receive help from around the league to make the playoffs. 
After a scoreless first half, Ottawa midfielder Mauro Eustaquio scored the game-winner in the 68th minute off a pass from Julian De Guzman . 
The outcome of the match was sealed in the 90th minute when second-half substitute Eric Hassli received a straight red card for a lunging tackle in the corner. 
The Scorpions will travel to South Florida for a Wednesday matchup with the Fort Lauderdale Strikers before playing their final home game of the season next Saturday at Toyota Field against the New York Cosmos . Latest Headlines
